channel.title: $r[message]
channel.description:
Currently the following code [code]

$r[message]

[/code] Works fine for a normal user sentence, example: My name is Fred, my voice is exceedingly annoying and if you visit my youtube channel you will want to hunt me down and shoot me in the face like this animated clip: http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/499200 But if the word/gibberish is all one [b]word[/b] it won't make an automatic line it will keep going, and going. Example: Thisisntgibberishandwhyareyoureadingthinganywayitsjustanexampleofhowpeoplecanmanipulatetheyrecommentstoruinapageoratleasttomakeitunneat. Is there a fix for this? __ if needed this is the website I had made from scratch: [ul][li][url=http://rs2.co.cc]rs2.co.cc[/url][/li] [li]Thread example: [url=http://rs2.co.cc/msg.php?id=17]http://rs2.co.cc/msg.php?id=17[/url][/li][/ul] __ Appreciate the help if someone replies. Thanks

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:379328”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=475173.msg3475044#msg3475044 date=1295628738]

Before storing the data in the table, put a space every Xth character, if it is one large word.

Or “\n” or " to make a new line.

\n will only put a new line in the source, not the page
[/quote]
\n will display as a space on the page[/quote]
It will only display as a linebreak if you have a CSS rule “whitespace: pre;” for the current tag.

[quote=“eczema3, post:13, topic:379328”][quote author=ModFireHeart link=topic=475173.msg3477694#msg3477694 date=1295825498]
  = space

= paragraph
= break on line

^^ I think that’s what u wanted? But I’m not sure
[/quote]
don’t be bad, use
[/quote]
So bad…

Read full topic

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:10, topic:379328”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=475173.msg3475058#msg3475058 date=1295631319]

Before storing the data in the table, put a space every Xth character, if it is one large word.

Or “\n” or " to make a new line.

\n will only put a new line in the source, not the page

\n will display as a space on the page
[/quote]Ummmm, no? This isn’t how it should work anyways. [/quote]Well it does…

Read full topic

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:8, topic:379328”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=475173.msg3475058#msg3475058 date=1295631319]

Before storing the data in the table, put a space every Xth character, if it is one large word.

Or “\n” or " to make a new line.

\n will only put a new line in the source, not the page

\n will display as a space on the page
[/quote]
No, it won’t. if you <?= "test\nnewline" ?> you will get on the page “testnewline” but in the source it will be:
“test
newline”[/quote]I dunno what browser you’re using, but on ff+chrome I get a space

Read full topic

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:379328”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=475173.msg3475044#msg3475044 date=1295628738]

Before storing the data in the table, put a space every Xth character, if it is one large word.

Or “\n” or " to make a new line.

\n will only put a new line in the source, not the page
[/quote]
\n will display as a space on the page[/quote]
No, it won’t. if you <?= "test\nnewline" ?> you will get on the page “testnewline” but in the source it will be:
“test
newline”

Read full topic

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:5, topic:379328”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=475173.msg3475033#msg3475033 date=1295626862]

Before storing the data in the table, put a space every Xth character, if it is one large word.

Or “\n” or " to make a new line.
[/quote]
\n will only put a new line in the source, not the page[/quote]
Ok, years since I touched PHP, so I just remembered wrong.
But I would rather use CSS for word-wrapping, and some limit for thread name.

  word-wrap: break-word;

item.title: $r[message]
item.dc:creator: @WW1 WW
item.description:
@WW1 wrote:

Currently the following code

<p style='max-width: 80%;'>$r[message]</p>

Works fine for a normal user sentence, example:

My name is Fred, my voice is exceedingly annoying and if you
visit my youtube channel you will want to hunt me down and
shoot me in the face like this animated clip:

Newgrounds.com

FRED - Animated Series

FRED as you've always wanted him!

But if the word/gibberish is all one word it won’t make an automatic line it will keep going, and going. Example:

Thisisntgibberishandwhyareyoureadingthinganywayitsjustanexampleofhowpeoplecanmanipulatetheyrecommentstoruinapageoratleasttomakeitunneat.

Is there a fix for this?
__

if needed this is the website I had made from scratch:

[ul][li]rs2.co.cc[/li]
[li]Thread example: http://rs2.co.cc/msg.php?id=17[/li][/ul]

__

Appreciate the help if someone replies. Thanks

Read full topic
